DEOXYS: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteorite underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.
TURTWIG: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
GROTLE: A Grotle that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.
TORTERRA: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.
CHIMCHAR: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
MONFERNO: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
INFERNAPE: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
PIPLUP: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
PRINPLUP: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
EMPOLEON: It avoids unnecessary disputes, but it will decimate anything that threatens its pride.
STARLY: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
STARAVIA: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
STARAPTOR: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.
BIDOOF: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
BIBAREL: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
KRICKETOT: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
KRICKETUNE: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
SHINX: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
LUXIO: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
LUXRAY: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
BUDEW: It lives alongside clear ponds. It scatters pollen that induces harsh sneezing and runny noses.
ROSERADE: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
CRANIDOS: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
RAMPARDOS: Its powerful headbutt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
SHIELDON: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
BASTIODON: When attacked, they form a wall with their shield like faces to protect their young.
BURMY: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
WORMADAM: It is said that a Wormadam that evolves on a cold day will have a thicker cloak.
MOTHIM: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.
COMBEE: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to Vespiquen.
VESPIQUEN: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.
PACHIRISU: It's one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.
BUIZEL: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
FLOATZEL: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.
CHERUBI: The small ball is not only full of nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.
CHERRIM: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
SHELLOS: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
GASTRODON: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
AMBIPOM: It is very difficult to dodge the consecutive strikes of its two tails.
DRIFLOON: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife.
DRIFBLIM: It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them off somewhere. Where do they go? Nobody knows.
BUNEARY: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
LOPUNNY: It sheds its fur twice a year. Its winter fur is soft and fluffy.
MISMAGIUS: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.
HONCHKROW: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.
GLAMEOW: With its sharp glare, it puts foes in a mild hypnotic state. It is a very fickle Pokémon.
PURUGLY: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
CHINGLING: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.
STUNKY: It sprays a nose-curling, stinky fluid from its rear to repel attackers.
SKUNTANK: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
BRONZOR: X-ray photos were taken to check its body structure. Nothing appeared, however.
BRONZONG: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.
BONSLY: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body's fluid levels.
MIME_JR: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
HAPPINY: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of Chansey.
CHATOT: Its tongue is just like a human's. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.
SPIRITOMB: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone.
GIBLE: It once lived in the tropics. To avoid the cold, it lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat.
GABITE: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot into its nest.
GARCHOMP: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
MUNCHLAX: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
RIOLU: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
LUCARIO: It has the ability to sense the Auras of all things. It understands human speech.
HIPPOPOTAS: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
HIPPOWDON: Surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of strength.
SKORUPI: It lives in arid lands. It buries itself in sand and lies in wait for unsuspecting prey.
DRAPION: Its body is encased in a sturdy shell. Its head rotates 180 degrees, eliminating blind spots.
CROAGUNK: Inflating its poison sacs, it makes an eerie blubbering sound for intimidation.
TOXICROAK: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
CARNIVINE: Hanging from branches using its tentacles, it looks like a plant. It awaits prey, mouth wide open.
FINNEON: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
LUMINEON: Lumineon swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.
MANTYKE: Scientists discovered that the distinctive patterns on its back differ by region.
SNOVER: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
ABOMASNOW: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as "The Ice Monster.\"
WEAVILE: It sends signals to others by carving odd patterns in frost-covered trees and ice.
MAGNEZONE: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
LICKILICKY: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
RHYPERIOR: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
TANGROWTH: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.
ELECTIVIRE: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
MAGMORTAR: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
TOGEKISS: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.
YANMEGA: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
LEAFEON: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
GLACEON: It causes small ice crystals to form by lowering the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere.
GLISCOR: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
MAMOSWINE: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
PORYGON_Z: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
GALLADE: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
PROBOPASS: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
DUSKNOIR: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
FROSLASS: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.
ROTOM: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
UXIE: Known as "The Being of Knowledge.\" It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
MESPRIT: Known as "The Being of Emotion.\" It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
AZELF: Known as "The Being of Willpower.\" It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
DIALGA: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga's heart beats.
PALKIA: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
HEATRAN: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
REGIGIGAS: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
GIRATINA: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
CRESSELIA: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.
PHIONE: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
MANAPHY: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
DARKRAI: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.
SHAYMIN: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.
ARCEUS: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
VICTINI: It creates an unlimited supply of energy inside its body, which it shares with those who touch it.
SNIVY: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.
SERVINE: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
SERPERIOR: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it.
TEPIG: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
PIGNITE: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
EMBOAR: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
OSHAWOTT: The scalchop on its stomach isn't just used for battle--it is also used to break open hard berries.
DEWOTT: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
SAMUROTT: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.
PATRAT: Extremely cautious, one of them is always on a lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.
WATCHOG: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
LILLIPUP: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.
HERDIER: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
STOUTLAND: This extremely wise Pokémon excels at rescuing people stranded at sea or in the mountains.
PURRLOIN: They trick people with cuteness, and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.
LIEPARD: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
PANSAGE: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
SIMISAGE: It strikes its enemies with a thorn-covered tail. The leaf on its head is bitter.
PANSEAR: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
SIMISEAR: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.
PANPOUR: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants using its tail.
SIMIPOUR: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
MUNNA: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.
MUSHARNA: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
PIDOVE: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
TRANQUILL: It can return to its Trainer's location regardless of the distance separating them.
UNFEZANT: Males swing the plumage on their heads to threaten others, but females are better at flying.
BLITZLE: Its mane shines when discharging electricity. It uses flashing manes to communicate with others.
ZEBSTRIKA: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
ROGGENROLA: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
BOLDORE: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
GIGALITH: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
WOOBAT: It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
SWOOBAT: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
DRILBUR: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
EXCADRILL: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can cut through a steel plate, no matter the thickness.
AUDINO: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
TIMBURR: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
GURDURR: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
CONKELDURR: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
TYMPOLE: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.
PALPITOAD: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.
SEISMITOAD: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.
THROH: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
SAWK: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
SEWADDLE: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
SWADLOON: Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.
LEAVANNY: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves.
VENIPEDE: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
WHIRLIPEDE: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
SCOLIPEDE: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponents and poison them.
COTTONEE: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body to serve as a decoy to distract the attacker.
WHIMSICOTT: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
PETILIL: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
LILLIGANT: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.
BASCULIN: Savage, violent Pokémon, red and blue Basculin are always fighting each other over territory.
SANDILE: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
KROKOROK: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.
KROOKODILE: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.
DARUMAKA: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees F.
DARMANITAN: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue then sharpens its mind and fights mentally.
MARACTUS: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
DWEBBLE: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.
CRUSTLE: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.
SCRAGGY: It immediately headbutts anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is massively thick.
SCRAFTY: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
SIGILYPH: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
YAMASK: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human.
COFAGRIGUS: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
TIRTOUGA: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
CARRACOSTA: Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.
ARCHEN: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can't yet fly.
ARCHEOPS: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
TRUBBISH: Wanting more garbage, they follow people who litter. They always belch poison gas.
GARBODOR: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
ZORUA: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
ZOROARK: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
MINCCINO: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
CINCCINO: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
GOTHITA: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
GOTHORITA: According to old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
GOTHITELLE: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their psychic power.
SOLOSIS: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.
DUOSION: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
REUNICLUS: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
DUCKLETT: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
SWANNA: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
VANILLITE: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokémon is treasured by households in warm regions.
VANILLISH: This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age. It's incredibly popular in very hot regions.
VANILLUXE: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.
DEERLING: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of its fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
SAWSBUCK: They migrate according to seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
EMOLGA: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
KARRABLAST: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
ESCAVALIER: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
FOONGUS: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Pok\e Ball then releases poison spores.
AMOONGUSS: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.
FRILLISH: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
JELLICENT: Jellicent is always hanging around fancy cruise ships and tankers, hoping to drag away its prey.
ALOMOMOLA: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
JOLTIK: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
GALVANTULA: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
FERROSEED: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.
FERROTHORN: By swinging around its three spiky feels and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
KLINK: Two bodies comprise a fixed pair. They spin around each other to generate energy.
KLANG: A mini and big gear comprise its body. If the mini gear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.
KLINKLANG: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
TYNAMO: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
EELEKTRIK: This Pokémon has a big appetite. When it spots its prey, it attacks it and paralyzes it with electricity.
EELEKTROSS: With its sucker mouth, it sucks in prey. Then it uses its fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
ELGYEM: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
BEHEEYEM: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.
LITWICK: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.
LAMPENT: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.
CHANDELURE: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
AXEW: Its large tusks have a tendency to break, but each time they grow back, they grow in harder and sturdier.
FRAXURE: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
HAXORUS: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. They are covered in hard armor.
CUBCHOO: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.
BEARTIC: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
CRYOGONAL: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
SHELMET: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
ACCELGOR: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
STUNFISK: When its opponent can't be paralyzed, it contorts itself with unexpected speed and flops away.
MIENFOO: It takes pride in the speed at which it uses moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
MIENSHAO: They use the long fur on their arms as a whip to strike their opponents.
DRUDDIGON: It runs through the narrow tunnels formed by Excadrill and Onix. It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.
GOLETT: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.
GOLURK: Golurk were created to protect people and Pokémon. They run on a mysterious energy.
PAWNIARD: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
BISHARP: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
BOUFFALANT: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
RUFFLET: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
BRAVIARY: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
VULLABY: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.
MANDIBUZZ: It skillfully arranges the bones of its prey to construct its nest. Most of the bones are Cubone.
HEATMOR: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.
DURANT: Durant dig nests in mountains. They build their complicated, interconnected tunnels in mazes.
DEINO: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.
ZWEILOUS: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
HYDREIGON: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
LARVESTA: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.
VOLCARONA: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.
COBALION: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
TERRAKION: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.
VIRIZION: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.
TORNADUS: In every direction it flies, creating winds so powerful, they blow everything away.
THUNDURUS: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.
RESHIRAM: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.
ZEKROM: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.
LANDORUS: Lands visited by Landorus grant bountiful crops. It has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields.\"
KYUREM: It can produce ultracold air. Its body is frozen.
KELDEO: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
MELOETTA: Many famous songs have been inspired by the melodies that Meloetta plays.
GENESECT: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
CHESPIN: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.
QUILLADIN: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators' attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
CHESNAUGHT: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
FENNEKIN: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to very hot air.
BRAIXEN: With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on its tail on fire and launches into battle.
DELPHOX: It gazes into the flame at its branch to achieve a focused state, allowing it to see the future.
FROAKIE: It secretes bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would take when attacked.
FROGADIER: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.
GRENINJA: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water, that can split metal in two.
BUNNELBY: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
DIGGERSBY: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble.
FLETCHLING: When it's excited, its temperature can double, spiking hormone production in its body.
FLETCHINDER: Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.
TALONFLAME: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.
SCATTERBUG: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
SPEWPA: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
VIVILLON: The colorful patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat.
LITLEO: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat and power flow through its body.
PYROAR: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
FLABEBE: It draws and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower it holds is most likely part of its body.
FLOETTE: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
FLORGES: Its life can span several hundred years. It's said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.
SKIDDO: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
GOGOAT: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
PANCHAM: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
PANGORO: This Pokémon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.
FURFROU: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.
ESPURR: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
MEOWSTIC: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck to dust.
HONEDGE: It is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches to people and drinks their life force.
DOUBLADE: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an accomplished opponent.
AEGISLASH: It can detect the innate qualities of leadership. Whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.
SPRITZEE: It emits a scent that delights those who smell it. The fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
AROMATISSE: It devises various scents and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
SWIRLIX: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
SLURPUFF: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs.
INKAY: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles.
MALAMAR: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do anything.
BINACLE: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
BARBARACLE: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
SKRELP: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.
DRAGALGE: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.
CLAUNCHER: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
CLAWITZER: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
HELIOPTILE: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
HELIOLISK: It flares its frill and generates energy. It can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
TYRUNT: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force to chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
TYRANTRUM: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
AMAURA: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
AURORUS: This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a surface temperature of around -240 degrees Fahrenheit.
SYLVEON: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
HAWLUCHA: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers.
DEDENNE: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers shoot electricity.
CARBINK: Born from temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
GOOMY: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
SLIGGOO: It crawls along sluggishly. The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with its brain and other organs.
GOODRA: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
KLEFKI: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
PHANTUMP: It is created when a spirit possesses rotten tree stumps. It prefers to live in abandoned forests.
TREVENANT: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
PUMPKABOO: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
GOURGEIST: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
BERGMITE: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any crack.
AVALUGG: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back make it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
NOIBAT: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
NOIVERN: This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it sees with ultrasonic waves that can crush boulders.
XERNEAS: When the horns on its head shine in seven different colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
YVELTAL: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon.
ZYGARDE: When the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
DIANCIE: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
HOOPA: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
VOLCANION: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
ROWLET: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer's pocket or bag as a nest.
DARTRIX: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
DECIDUEYE: Although basically cool and cautious, when it's caught by surprise, it's seized by panic.
LITTEN: It doesn't allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
TORRACAT: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
INCINEROAR: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
POPPLIO: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
BRIONNE: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.
PRIMARINA: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
PIKIPEK: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
TRUMBEAK: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
TOUCANNON: Known for forming harmonious couples, it is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
YUNGOOS: It prefers to eat fresh living things so it marches down streets in search of prey.
GUMSHOOS: Patient by nature, it loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal-Rattata!
GRUBBIN: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
CHARJABUG: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
VIKAVOLT: It flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to attack.
CRABRAWLER: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense.
CRABOMINABLE: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
ORICORIO: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.
CUTIEFLY: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
RIBOMBEE: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
ROCKRUFF: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you.
LYCANROC: Well equipped with claws and fangs, it uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
WISHIWASHI: They're weak, so they move in schools. However, they can also often be seen all alone, having strayed from the school.
MAREANIE: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they're cut off.
TOXAPEX: It crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
MUDBRAY: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
MUDSDALE: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.
DEWPIDER: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its head.
ARAQUANID: It delivers headbutts with the bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into it, where they drown.
FOMANTIS: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.
LURANTIS: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.
MORELULL: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
SHIINOTIC: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!
SALANDIT: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. It weakens enemies and sends them reeling with it.
SALAZZLE: It punishes Salandit that couldn't bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.
STUFFUL: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.
BEWEAR: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in Alola region.
BOUNSWEET: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it.
STEENEE: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. It's quite painful when it smacks you!
TSAREENA: A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.
COMFEY: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect so it is a hit to many people.
ORANGURU: Known for its extreme intelligence, it will look down on inexperienced Trainers.
PASSIMIAN: They form groups of 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable-they will never let down a comrade.
WIMPOD: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, it whirs its legs at high speed to run away if anything comes near it.
GOLISOPOD: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater-or even air-right in two.
SANDYGAST: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
PALOSSAND: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.
PYUKUMUKU: Its body is covered with slime. If you accidentally step on it, you'll slip, and it will get mad at you!
TYPE_NULL: There's danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.
SILVALLY: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing type by equipping special memories.
MINIOR: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
KOMALA: It stays asleep from the moment it's born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.
TURTONATOR: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance.
TOGEDEMARU: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.
MIMIKYU: It conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and Pokémon.
BRUXISH: Its skin is thick enough to fend off spikes. With its robust teeth, it crunches up and eats the spikes.
DRAMPA: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they're in danger.
DHELMISE: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey.
JANGMO_O: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. It grows as it battles others.
HAKAMO_O: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
KOMMO_O: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.
TAPU_KOKO: This guardian deity of Melemele summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
TAPU_LELE: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. Its flowers' fragrant aroma is its source of energy.
TAPU_BULU: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes.
TAPU_FINI: The guardian deity of Poni can control water. It can create pure water that will wash away any impurity.
COSMOG: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
COSMOEM: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.
SOLGALEO: In writings from the distant past, it's called by the name "the beast that devours the sun.\"
LUNALA: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.
NIHILEGO: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
BUZZWOLE: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
PHEROMOSA: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
XURKITREE: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so it energizes itself with electricity.
CELESTEELA: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
KARTANA: This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
GUZZLORD: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry-it is certainly always devouring something.
NECROZMA: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn't devouring light, impurities build up in it.
MAGEARNA: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
MARSHADOW: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. It is craven and cowering.
POIPOLE: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
NAGANADEL: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid in its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
STAKATAKA: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute's true identity was this mysterious life-form.
BLACEPHALON: It causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents' surprise to rob them of their vitality.
ZERAORA: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
MELTAN: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its molten steel body.
MELMETAL: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, it has come back to life after 3000 years.
GROOKEY: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
THWACKEY: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
RILLABOOM: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
SCORBUNNY: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Its pads radiate tremendous heat.
RABOOT: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
CINDERACE: It gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
SOBBLE: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
DRIZZILE: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
INTELEON: It picks out foes' weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips.
SKWOVET: This Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
GREEDENT: This Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.
ROOKIDEE: It will bravely challenge any foe, no matter how powerful. Even suffering a defeat increases its strength a bit.
CORVISQUIRE: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent's strength.
CORVIKNIGHT: The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
BLIPBUG: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn't.
DOTTLER: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor its surroundings and wait for evolution.
ORBEETLE: It's famous for its high intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it has immense psychic power.
NICKIT: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of others. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
THIEVUL: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. It secretly marks its future targets.
GOSSIFLEUR: It anchors itself in the ground and basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, it blooms vividly.
ELDEGOSS: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that others can benefit.
WOOLOO: If its fleece grows too long, it won't be able to move. Cloth made with its wool is surprisingly durable.
DUBWOOL: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
CHEWTLE: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
DREDNAW: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
YAMPER: This greedy Pokémon only helps people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
BOLTUND: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
ROLYCOLY: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
CARKOL: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can easily travel at over 18 mph. It forms coal inside its body.
COALOSSAL: While engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, scorching the surrounding area with sparks.
APPLIN: As soon as it's born, it burrows into an apple. the flavor of the apple is what determines its evolution.
FLAPPLE: It ate a sour apple, which induced its evolution. It stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns in its cheeks.
APPLETUN: It ate a sweet apple, which induced its evolution. Back in the day, children used to have it as a snack.
SILICOBRA: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
SANDACONDA: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. It becomes disheartened if it runs out.
CRAMORANT: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow other Pokémon.
ARROKUDA: It becomes extremely sluggish after eating its fill. That's when Cramorant swallows it up.
BARRASKEWDA: Its jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. It spins its tail fins to surge forward at over 100 knots.
TOXEL: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. Despite a weak voltage, it can cause paralysis.
TOXTRICITY: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.
SIZZLIPEDE: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. It then coils around its prey and cooks it.
CENTISKORCH: This excessively hostile Pokémon has large and very sharp fangs in addition to its dangerous burning body.
CLOBBOPUS: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles.
GRAPPLOCT: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
SINISTEA: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
POLTEAGEIST: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
HATENNA: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. It prefers areas without people.
HATTREM: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
HATTERENE: Known as the Forest Witch, if you are too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle.
IMPIDIMP: It sneaks into people's homes, taking and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
MORGREM: With sly cunning, it lures people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.
GRIMMSNARL: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to foes, ensnaring them like tentacles.
OBSTAGOON: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that'd make anyone flinch.
PERRSERKER: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
CURSOLA: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You'll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
SIRFETCHD: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk.
MR_RIME: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
RUNERIGUS: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you'll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
MILCERY: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
ALCREMIE_STRAWBERRY: It evolved from a Milcery that held onto a Strawberry Sweet. Its flavor depends on how it was mixed.
FALINKS: The six of them work together as one. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change formation.
PINCURCHIN: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
SNOM: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger its spikes grow.
FROSMOTH: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains.
STONJOURNER: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
EISCUE: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to stay cold.
INDEEDEE: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Males will act as valets for those they serve.
MORPEKO: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pouches, it generates electricity while satisfying its constant hunger.
CUFANT: If a job requires serious strength, Cufant will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning green.
COPPERAJAH: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks.
DRACOZOLT: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Its upper half is entirely too small.
ARCTOZOLT: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
DRACOVISH: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but it can't breathe unless it's underwater.
ARCTOVISH: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made it go extinct anyway.
DURALUDON: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. However, its body rusts easily.
DREEPY: After being reborn as a ghost, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
DRAKLOAK: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they evolve.
DRAGAPULT: Apparently the Dreepy inside its horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.
ZACIAN: It has slumbered for many years. Some say it is Zamazenta's elder sister, others say the two are rivals.
ZAMAZENTA: It slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
ETERNATUS: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. The energy that its core absorbs allows it to live.
KUBFU: If it pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from deep in its belly.
URSHIFU_SINGLE: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, it races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
ZARUDE: Once the vines on its body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.
REGIELEKI: Its entire body is made of an organ that generates electricity. It is capable of generating a region's worth of electricity.
REGIDRAGO: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. It is said to contain the power of every Dragon Pokémon.
GLASTRIER: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength. The mask covering its face is 100 times stronger than diamond.
SPECTRIER: As it dashes through the night, it absorbs the life energy of sleeping Pokémon. It craves silence and solitude.
CALYREX: Its every move is filled with grace and dignity. Extremely intelligent, it is said to see past, present, and future events.
WYRDEER: The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
KLEAVOR: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone.
URSALUNA: Swampy terrain gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
BASCULEGION: It clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream.
SNEASLER: It has virulent poison and daunting physical prowess. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
OVERQWIL: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname "sea fiend.\"
ENAMORUS: According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across the land. //Special Form Entries
RATTATA_A: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for its boss-Raticate.
RATICATE_A: It makes its Rattata underlings gather food for it, dining solely on the most nutritious and delicious fare.
RAICHU_A: It focuses psychic energy into its tail and rides it like it's surfing. Another name for this Pokémon is "hodad.\"
SANDSHREW_A: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard-so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.
SANDSLASH_A: It runs across snow-covered plains at high speeds. It developed thick, sharp claws to plow through the snow.
VULPIX_A: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
NINETALES_A: It lives on mountains perpetually covered in snow and is revered as a deity incarnate.
DIGLETT_A: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
DUGTRIO_A: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.
MEOWTH_A: It's impulsive, selfish, and fickle. It's very popular with Trainers who like giving it the attention it needs.
MEOWTH_G: These daring Pokémon have coins on their foreheads. Darker coins are harder, and harder coins garner more respect.
PERSIAN_A: It has the classiest coat. The rippling of its fur in the heat of battle has a beauty all its own.
GEODUDE_A: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.
GRAVELER_A: Graveler's entire body is tinged with electricity due to the stones it likes to eat. It's very quick-tempered.
GOLEM_A: Since it can't fire boulders at a rapid pace, it's been known to seize nearby Geodude and fire them from its back.
PONYTA_G: Its small horn hides a healing power. With a few rubs from this its horn, any slight wound you have will be healed.
RAPIDASH_G: Brave and prideful, it dashes airily through the forest, its steps aided by psychic powers stored in its fetlocks.
SLOWPOKE_G: Because it eats the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.
SLOWBRO_G: A Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside its body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type.
FARFETCHD_G: It uses the stalks of leeks that are larger and thicker than usual, which made them to adapt to a unique form.
GRIMER_A: A Grimer, which had been brought in to solve a problem with garbage, developed over time into this form.
MUK_A: The garbage it eats causes continuous chemical changes in its body, which produce its vivid coloration.
EXEGGUTOR_A: It swings its long neck like a whip and smacks its opponents. This makes Exeggutor itself dizzy, too.
MAROWAK_A: Its custom is to mourn its lost friends. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.
WEEZING_G: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.
MR_MIME_G: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It'll spend its day tap dancing on a frozen floor.
ARTICUNO_G: Known as Articuno, this Pokémon fires beams that can immobilize opponents as if they had been frozen solid.
ZAPDOS_G: One kick from its powerful legs will pulverize a dump truck. It runs through the mountains at over 180 mph.
MOLTRES_G: Its sinister, flame-like aura consumes the spirit of any creature it hits. Victims become burned-out shadows of themselves.
SLOWKING_G: While chanting strange spells, Slowking combines its internal toxins with what it's eaten, creating strange potions.
CORSOLA_G: Sudden climate change wiped out this ancient kind of Corsola. It absorbs the life force of others through its branches.
ZIGZAGOON_G: It moves in zigzags and wreaks havoc upon its surroundings. It is thought to be the oldest form of Zigzagoon.
LINOONE_G: It uses its long tongue to taunt foes. Once the opposition is enraged, it hurls itself, tackling them forcefully.
DARUMAKA_G: They freeze their breath to make snowballs, using them as ammo for playful snowball fights.
DARMANITAN_G: Though it has a gentle disposition, it's also very strong. It stashes food in the snowball on its head.
DARMANITAN_G_ZEN: Anger has reignited its atrophied flame sac. This Pokémon spews fire all over as it rampages indiscriminately.
YAMASK_G: It's said that this Pokémon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.
STUNFISK_G: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, it will clamp down hard.
ZYGARDE_10: Born when around 10% of Zygarde's cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.
ZYGARDE_COMPLETE: This is Zygarde's 100% form. It has enough power to overwhelm even Xerneas or Yveltal.
ORICORIO_Y: This Oricorio has sipped bright yellow nectar. Its bright, cheerful dance melts the hearts of its enemies.
ORICORIO_P: This Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. Its enemies' hearts melt at the sight of its gently swaying hips.
ORICORIO_S: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Some dancers use its graceful, elegant dancing as inspiration.
LYCANROC_N: They live alone without forming packs. They only listen to orders from those who can draw out their true power.
LYCANROC_DUSK: This strange form is the result of it evolving at dusk. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.
WISHIWASHI_S: At their appearance, even Gyarados flee. When they team up to use Water Gun, its power exceeds that of Hydro Pump.
NECROZMA_DUSK_MANE: This is Necrozma while it's absorbing the power of Solgaleo, making it very ferocious and impossible to control.
NECROZMA_DAWN_WINGS: Lunala no longer has a will of its own. Now under the control of Necrozma, it continuously expels all of its energy.
NECROZMA_ULTRA: This is its form when it has absorbed overwhelming light energy. It fires laser beams from all over its body.
MAGEARNA_P: It functions thanks to its artificial soul. The vivid decoration is proof that it was presented as a gift to royalty.
CRAMORANT_GULPING: The slightest shock is sometimes enough to get this Pokémon to spit out the Arrokuda lodged in its throat.
CRAMORANT_GORGING: This Cramorant has accidentally gotten a Pikachu lodged in its gullet. While it seems to be choking, it isn't bothered.
TOXTRICITY_LOW_KEY: While generating electricity, it fills surroundings with what sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.
SINISTEA_CHIPPED: The swirl pattern in its body is its weakness. If it gets stirred, the swirl loses its shape, and it gets dizzy.
POLTEAGEIST_CHIPPED: When angered, it launches tea from its body at the offender's mouth. The tea causes strong chills if swallowed.
ALCREMIE_BERRY: It evolved from a Milcery that held onto a Berry Sweet. The flavor of its cream depends on how it was mixed.
ALCREMIE_CLOVER: It evolved from a Milcery that held onto a Clover Sweet. The flavor of its cream depends on how it was mixed.
ALCREMIE_FLOWER: It evolved from a Milcery that held onto a Flower Sweet. The flavor of its cream depends on how it was mixed.
ALCREMIE_LOVE: It evolved from a Milcery that held onto a Love Sweet. The flavor of its cream depends on how it was mixed.
ALCREMIE_RIBBON: It evolved from a Milcery that held onto a Ribbon Sweet. The flavor of its cream depends on how it was mixed.
ALCREMIE_STAR: It evolved from a Milcery that held onto a Star Sweet. The flavor of its cream depends on how it was mixed.
EISCUE_NOICE: The ice covering this Pokémon's face has shattered, revealing a worried expression that many are enamored with.
INDEEDEE_FEMALE: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.
MORPEKO_HANGRY: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.
ZACIAN_CROWNED: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell any target.
ZAMAZENTA_CROWNED: Now that it has equipped its shield, it can shrug off impressive blows, even from Dynamaxed foes.
ETERNATUS_ETERNAMAX: Infinite amounts of energy pour from this Pokémon's enlarged core, warping the surrounding space-time.
URSHIFU_RAPID: This form of Urshifu strongly believes in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them.
ZARUDE_DADA: This Zarude left its pack to raise a human child. It would wrap the child with its cloth to calm the child's crying.
CALYREX_ICE_RIDER: It is said that this Pokémon once moved a large forest to a new location overnight.
CALYREX_SHADOW_RIDER: It is said that by using its power, this Pokémon saved the creatures of a forest from a meteorite strike.
GROWLITHE_H: These Pokémon live in packs in the snowy mountains and defend themselves with icy breath.
ARCANINE_H: It is said to guide virtuous people who have lost their way on mountain paths back down to the mountain's base.
VOLTORB_H: When excited, Voltorb discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great laugh.
ELECTRODE_H: When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
TYPHLOSION_H: It is said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife.
QWILFISH_H: Fisherman detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere.
SNEASEL_H: From the tips of its claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in its grasp.
SAMUROTT_H: Hard of heart and deft of blade, its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
LILLIGANT_H: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes when dried in the sun and boiled.
BASCULIN_H: This Basculin differs from others in several respects, including its demeanor - this one is gentle.
ZORUA_H: A once-departed soul, returned to life. It derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head.
ZOROARK_H: Heedless of its own safety, it attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates its own body.
BRAVIARY_H: It is said to blast lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.
SLIGGOO_H: It is said its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in ancient water.
GOODRA_H: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy.
AVALUGG_H: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease.
